property.name: hybrid.sim.threshold
property.description: this should be same as partitioning threshold

property.name: hybrid.block.number
property.description: Block-0, Block-1, Block-3

property.name: hadoop.splitting.enabled
property.description: hadoop splitting files into mapred.min.split.size

property.name: hadoop.split.size
property.description: split size in MB per S if hybrid.hadoop.splitting is set

property.name: hybrid.split.size
property.description: number of vectors per partition (big S) if hadoop.splitting.enabled = false

property.name: hybrid.io.block
property.description: read other block size into B

property.name: hybrid.comp.block
property.description: process this number of vectors less than or equal hybrid.io.block

property.name: hybrid.multiple.s
property.description: split S into multiple inveted indexes

property.name: hybrid.number.splits
property.description: split S into this number of indexes if hybrid.multiple.s is true
static partitioning naming used to skip

property.name: hybrid.dot.partitions
property.description: enable partitions level dot product.

property.name: hybrid.circular.enable
property.description: enable load balacing through circular assignment

property.name: hybrid.google.skip
property.description: google dynamic skipping applied for only singleS/block-0 and change p.norm

property.name: hybrid.partition.dot.vector
property.description: enable partition vs. vector dot check for candidates.

property.name: hybrid.loops.loopb
property.description: Loop order for block-1 is loopS{loopB} when true otherwise, opposite if false.

property.name: hybrid.multi.threads
property.description: block-0 only, if multiple S is used then make it multi-thread

property.name: hybrid.exclude.myself
property.description: Do not compare with myself

property.name: hybrid.single.map
property.description: run single map for measurement purposes

property.name: hybrid.log.enable
property.description: print logging enabled

property.name: hybrid.load.balancing
property.description: www loadbalancing technique,0=none,1=step1,2=step2,3=step3,12=step1and2,13=step1and3,23=step2and3
